newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Posteel says seeks 500T of ferro-chrome.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Posteel says seeks 500T of ferro-chrome.

text.p: South Korea's Posco Steel Service and Sales Co Ltd (Posteel) said on Wednesday it will invite tenders for buying 500 tonnes of medium-carbon ferro-chrome by 11.00 a.m. (0200 GMT) on January 29.
Posteel is an affiliate of Pohang Iron and Steel Co Ltd, South Korea's largest steel maker.

A Posteel official said it will also invite tenders for 170 tonnes of low-carbon ferro-manganese, 68 tonnes of ferro-vanadium, 252 tonnes of titanium sponge, and 750 tonnes of ferro-phosphorus at the same time.
The official said if it passes on the tenders in whole or partially due to high prices, it will re-tender on February 5.

Arrival of ferrochrome was set for March 30 (300 tonnes)/April (200 tonnes), ferro-manganese for March (85 tonnes)/ April (85 tonnes) and ferro-vanadium for February (17 tonnes)/March (17 tonnes)/April(34 tonnes).
Arrival of titanium sponge was also scheduled for March (84 tonnes)/April (168 tonnes), and ferro-phosphorus for February (170 tonnes)/March (290 tonnes)/April (290 tonnes).
Arrival port was slated for the southeastern city of Pusan.
